cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles southwest of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: The system is expected to turn northwest later today and then north on Saturday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then up the Mississippi Valley.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle; Intracoastal City to Cameron. Tropical Storm Watch: East of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (including metropolitan New Orleans), Intracoastal City to Cameron. Storm Surge Warning: Intracoastal City to Biloxi, including Lake Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City LA eastward to Biloxi MS, including metropolitan New Orleans and the Mississippi Delta.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely in the New Orleans area Friday night through Saturday; brief hurricane-force gusts are possible if Barry reaches hurricane strength before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation is possible in Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent tidal waterways, including the New Orleans metro area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches with locally higher totals could fall across southeast Louisiana, producing life-threatening flash flooding and river flooding in and around New Orleans.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes are possible in outer rain bands Friday afternoon through Saturday.
